name: netgroup Chef cookbook
readme:
netgroup Cookbook
=================
This cookbook provides the netgroup LWRP.  It will allow you to manage netgroups in the __/etc/netgroup__ file


Requirements
------------
- Chef 0.10.10+

The following platforms are known to work:

- Red Hat family (Redhat, CentOS, Oracle etc)
- This cookbook SHOULD work with any POSIX platform that is chef compliant.  Although testing was only performed on Redhat 5.5 and Redhat 6.X platforms.

Attributes
----------
None

Usage
-----
The netgroup resource has two attributes users and groups. Each attribute is expecting an array of either users or groups.  The default value
is an empty list so neither attribute is required.  

__The three actions that can be invoked are__

    :manage   : allows chef to manage the resource so it can be referenced in other recipes.  
    :create   : create the netgroup if it does not exist. If it does it exist bring it into compliance
    :remove   : remove the netgroup.  

Example usage

```ruby
include_recipe 'netgroup'

netgroup 'SYSADMIN' do
  users ['user1','user2']
  action :create
end

netgroup 'SUDOROOT' do
  users ['user3']
  groups ['SYSADMIN']
  action :create
end
```

Adding Additional Users and Groups
----------
You can also adjust netgroup resources in other recipes. 

For example. Say the SYSADMIN netgroup resource was loaded in recipe 'A'.  You can add users to this netgroup in 
recipe 'B' by including the following code. 

```ruby
include_recipe 'A'

# Append the users netgroup
netgroup_resource = resources(:netgroup => "SYSADMIN")
netgroup_resource.users netgroup_resource.users + ['user3']

# Overwrite the groups in the SYSADMIN negroup resource
netgroup_resource = resources(:netgroup => "SYSADMIN")
netgroup_resource.groups ['NETGROUP1']
```
